column4: My dmesg start with " Initializing cgroup subsys cpuset". What is meant by 'cgroup'?

This is then the first time that I am aware that my Ubuntu uses IPv6. (I managed this morning for the first time to transfer a file using ssh.) Is it normal that Ubuntu uses IPv6 for ssh but almost not otherwise?
it doesn't "use" IPv6 for anything else it's supported throughout the entire network route
so, chances are, it's not used at all unless you've explicitly configured your internal network as such.

I did not do anything else than to install Ubuntu 8.04's DEB program packages and did not tune them by hand. So I suppose that Ubuntu 8.04 first tries as a default IPv6 and only if this is not supported (somewhere) then Ubuntu 8.04 will use  TCP IPv4.
that's the behaviour of apps that are dualstacked.
Please tell me what applications are dualstacked and what applications are not?
not without static or runtime analysis
I'm pretty sure you want to see the other man pages, e.g., trackerd, tracker-applet
Ah! Thank you very much for your help.
